name: places/ChIJYys7EGr2wokRcH0_LcUWCC8
adrFormatAddress: 3180 Broadway, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text: I feel very disappointed with the Columbia University Employment Information Center.  They were not able to help me get my job search on track.  While they tried helping me with my cover letter and referring me to a role within Columbia University, there was no real follow through.  I don’t recommend anyone waste their time with this place unless you are unemployed.  The staff are very kind though.

text.text: I feel very disappointed with the Columbia University Employment Information Center.  They were not able to help me get my job search on track. originalText.text: The lady at the front is not professional, and asked what experience do I have right when I walked in, that is a question you ask someone when you sit down with them and make a one on one conversation with them. Not to mention, the language barrier is an issue for native English speaking students. If legacy student have parents that fund their education for Columbia, it is the schools responsibility to provide the best service. Very disappointed and highly don't recommend.

originalText.text: Honestly terrible they make a 3rd party do a background check then months later just to find out thr work environment is just really toxic on some many levels

originalText.text: Front reception lady is not helpful, do better Columbia for your students! Would not be a school without students attending!

text.text: Front reception lady is not helpful, do better Columbia for your students! Would not be a school without students attending!

originalText.text: The staff here is amazing! Always informative and willing to go above and beyond to assist in any way they can! I was provided tips on how to improve my resume and had an exploratory interview that really helped my interviewing skills and confidence. The free online courses offered for professional development are great! I would recommend the staff and their excellent support!
